de.ityx.mediatrix.api.client

Interface ICTextObject


  • public interface ICTextObject
    Provides functions to manage text objects ITextObject TextObject .
    How to use:
    API.getClientAPI().getTextObjectAPI().delete(textobject);

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      • getTextObjectHistories

        List<ITextObject> getTextObjectHistories(int projectId,
                                       int categoryId,
                                       String text,
                                       boolean loadLongText)
        Searches for text objects which have a valid version at the time the query has been started. Only textobjekts which can be used for replying eMails will be returned. Parameters for searching are project id, category id, part of the text. loadLongText determines whether to load the full text of the text object
        Parameters:
        projectId - project id
        categoryId - category id
        text - part of a text from the text object
        loadLongText - true, if long text of the text object will be loaded
        Returns:
        list of ITextObject

      • getTextObjectHistories

        List<ITextObject> getTextObjectHistories(int projectId,
                                       int categoryId,
                                       String text,
                                       boolean loadLongText,
                                       boolean conjunction,
                                       Set<Language> languages)
        Searches for text objects which have a valid version at the time the query has been started. Only textobjekts
        which can be used for replying eMails will be returned.

        You can search for TextObjects with the AND or OR conjunction
        Sample TextObject:
        Subject: This is a TextObject
        Body: Hello World from Germany!

        With the given parameter text (This is b) and the conjunction AND
        you would find nothing instead if you use OR and the same text, you would find the sample TextObject.
        NOTE that the text affects the subject and the text!

        Another example for the language parameter:
        Given a TextObject 'A' with the language: German.
        You can find this TextObject under this circumstances:
        • The parameter languages is empty.
        • languages contains German.
        • languages contains Language.L_ALL
        NOTE that you'll also find TextObjects which have no language assigned (e.g. Language.L_ALL)
        Parameters:
        projectId - The project id.
        categoryId - category id of the TextObject, -1 for all.
        text - part of a text from a TextObject.
        loadLongText - determines whether to load the full text of the text object.
        conjunction - true means the logical AND, and false OR.
        languages - Languages to search for.
        Returns:
        list of ITextObjects.
